title: K. Ananda Rau
summary: K. Ananda Rau (21 September 1893 â€“ 22 January 1966) was an eminent Indian mathematician  and a contemporary of Ramanujan. Though Rau was six years junior to Ramanujan, his mathematical trajectory, unlike Ramanujan's, was very much a conventional one and he had decided to pursue a career in mathematics well before Ramanujan's prowess became known.
